intro: Alkanna pamphylica, commonly known as the pale alkanna, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Alkanna pamphylica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and historical use in natural dyes.
